section1.title: 1. Controller Information
section1.address_value: 123 Rue de la Santé, 75014 Paris, France

section2.title: 2. Legal Basis for Processing Health Data
section2.description: Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Article 9, we process your health data based on the following legal grounds:

primary.title: Primary Legal Basis: Article 9(2)(h) - Healthcare Provision
primary.description: We process your health data as it is necessary for:
primary.provision: Provision of healthcare and medical treatment
primary.note: This processing is conducted under contract with licensed healthcare professionals who are subject to professional secrecy obligations under EU and Member State law.

secondary.title: Secondary Legal Basis: Article 9(2)(a) - Explicit Consent
secondary.description: Where required, we obtain your explicit consent for processing health data for specific purposes including:
secondary.history: Storing consultation history for continuity of care
secondary.sharing: Sharing data with specialists for referrals
secondary.anonymized: Using anonymized data for service improvement

health.title: 3.1 Health Data (Special Category Data)
health.documents: Medical images or documents you provide

healthcare.title: 4.1 Healthcare Purposes (Article 9(2)(h))
healthcare.records: Maintaining medical records for continuity of care

professionals.title: 5.1 Healthcare Professionals
professionals.description: Your health data is shared with:
professionals.specialists: Specialist doctors for referrals (with your consent)

providers.title: 5.2 Service Providers
providers.supabase: Supabase: Database hosting and management (EU-based servers)
providers.cloud: Cloud storage providers: For secure data backup (EU-based)

legal_req.title: 5.3 Legal Requirements
legal_req.description: We may disclose data when required by:

section6.title: 6. International Data Transfers
section6.description: All health data is processed and stored within the European Union. Any transfers outside the EU are conducted under appropriate safeguards:
section6.adequacy: Adequacy decisions by the European Commission

health.title: 7.1 Health Data
health.records: Active medical records: Retained for 10 years after last consultation
health.recordings: Consultation recordings: Deleted after 30 days unless consent given for longer retention
health.prescriptions: Prescription data: Retained as required by national pharmacy regulations

personal.title: 7.2 Personal Data
personal.account: Account data: Retained while account is active plus 3 years
personal.payment: Payment data: Retained for 7 years for tax compliance
personal.marketing: Marketing data: Retained until consent is withdrawn

access.title: 8.1 Access Rights (Article 15)
access.description: You have the right to obtain confirmation of data processing and access to your personal data.

rectification.title: 8.2 Rectification Rights (Article 16)
rectification.description: You can request correction of inaccurate or incomplete personal data.

erasure.title: 8.3 Erasure Rights (Article 17)
erasure.description: You can request deletion of your data, subject to legal retention requirements.

restriction.title: 8.4 Restriction Rights (Article 18)
restriction.description: You can request restriction of processing in certain circumstances.

portability.title: 8.5 Portability Rights (Article 20)
portability.description: You can request transfer of your data to another healthcare provider.

objection.title: 8.6 Objection Rights (Article 21)
objection.description: You can object to processing based on legitimate interests.

withdrawal.title: 8.7 Consent Withdrawal
withdrawal.description: You can withdraw consent at any time for processing based on consent.

section9.title: 9. Security Measures
section9.description: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures:
section9.aes: AES-256 encryption for data at rest
section9.audits: Regular security audits and penetration testing

section10.title: 10. Data Breach Notification
section10.description: In case of a data breach affecting your rights and freedoms:
section10.authority: We will notify the supervisory authority within 72 hours
section10.subject: We will inform you without undue delay if high risk is involved
section10.documentation: We will document all breaches and remedial actions taken

section11.title: 11. Supervisory Authority
section11.description: You have the right to lodge a complaint with your national data protection authority:
section11.france: France: Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertés (CNIL)
section11.germany: Germany: Federal Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information
section11.other: Other EU countries: Your national data protection authority

section12.title: 12. Contact Information
section12.description: For any privacy-related questions or to exercise your rights:
section12.address_value: 123 Rue de la Santé, 75014 Paris, France

section13.title: 13. Changes to This Policy
section13.description: We may update this privacy policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will:
section13.notify: Notify you of material changes via email

footer.note: This privacy policy complies with GDPR, ePrivacy Directive, and applicable national healthcare data protection laws.
